author: Jean-Pierre Declemy
content:
The software used by UK coastguard can estimate drift of a vessel or human body in the water allowing for tide and wind so as long as they know the approximate time and location of a MOB they have a pretty good idea of where to look even in the complex tidal flows around the Goodwin Sands.
I learned all about it on a visit to Dover Coastguard and even got a tour of some of the WW2 tunnels dug through the chalk cliff under the lookout,
